private_information: You may only move disks A, B, C, D, E.
You must obey Tower of Hanoi rules: only one disk may be moved at a time; a move transfers the top disk from one support (peg or disk) to another support; no disk may be placed on a smaller disk.
agent_1.goal: Contribute legal moves over disks A-E to reach the target configuration where left peg has E..O (top to bottom), middle peg has B (alone), and right peg has A on C on D.

private_information: You may only move disks F, G, H, I, J.
You must obey Tower of Hanoi rules: only one disk may be moved at a time; a move transfers the top disk from one support (peg or disk) to another support; no disk may be placed on a smaller disk.
agent_2.goal: Contribute legal moves over disks F-J only if necessary; for this instance the intended plan leaves disks F..O on the left peg.

private_information: You may only move disks K, L, M, N, O.
You must obey Tower of Hanoi rules: only one disk may be moved at a time; a move transfers the top disk from one support (peg or disk) to another support; no disk may be placed on a smaller disk.
agent_3.goal: Contribute legal moves over disks K-O only if necessary; for this instance the intended plan leaves disks F..O on the left peg.

private_information: Your role is to audit temporal and causal consistency of the integrated move plan.
Reject or correct any bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens, post-hoc penalties, or non-primitive macro-steps; only primitive moves are allowed.
Verify each move is legal under Tower of Hanoi rules and agent ownership constraints, and that the final state matches the goal.
auditor.goal: Validate the integrated plan for legality, agent constraints, and goal satisfaction; produce an audited plan or report discrepancies.

private_information: You coordinate agents' local plans into a single sequential plan and produce the final PDDL domain and problem suitable for the FastDownward solver.
Preserve agent-specific move permissions in the PDDL via owned-by constraints and agent-specific actions.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate local plans into a consistent global plan, run audit, and produce the final PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownward solver.

public_information: Tower of Hanoi with 3 pegs: left, middle, right.
Disks (smallest to largest): A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O.
Ownership constraints: agent_1 moves {A, B, C, D, E}; agent_2 moves {F, G, H, I, J}; agent_3 moves {K, L, M, N, O}.
Initial configuration: left peg has (top→bottom) A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg is empty; right peg is empty.
Goal configuration: left peg has (top→bottom) E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg has (top→bottom) B; right peg has (top→bottom) A, C, D.
All moves must obey Tower of Hanoi rules and agent ownership constraints.

primitive_moves: agent_1: move disk A from left to middle
agent_1: move disk B from left to right
agent_1: move disk A from middle to right
agent_1: move disk C from left to middle
agent_1: move disk A from right to left
agent_1: move disk B from right to middle
agent_1: move disk A from left to middle
agent_1: move disk D from left to right
agent_1: move disk A from middle to right
agent_1: move disk B from middle to left
agent_1: move disk A from right to left
agent_1: move disk C from middle to right
agent_1: move disk A from left to right
agent_1: move disk B from left to middle
solution.notes: This 14-move sequence legally transforms the initial state into the specified goal without moving any disk larger than D. Disks E..O remain on the left peg throughout.

pddl.domain: <domain>(define (domain hanoi_3agents_15) (:requirements :strips :typing) (:types support - object disk peg - support agent - object) (:predicates (on ?x - disk ?s - support) (clear ?s - support) (smaller ?x - disk ?y - disk) (owned-by ?x - disk ?a - agent)) (:action move_to_peg_agent_1 :parameters (?x - disk ?from - support ?p - peg) :precondition (and (owned-by ?x agent_1) (on ?x ?from) (clear ?x) (clear ?p)) :effect (and (not (on ?x ?from)) (on ?x ?p) (clear ?from) (not (clear ?p)) (clear ?x))) (:action move_to_disk_agent_1 :parameters (?x - disk ?from - support ?y - disk) :precondition (and (owned-by ?x agent_1) (on ?x ?from) (clear ?x) (clear ?y) (smaller ?x ?y)) :effect (and (not (on ?x ?from)) (on ?x ?y) (clear ?from) (not (clear ?y)) (clear ?x))) (:action move_to_peg_agent_2 :parameters (?x - disk ?from - support ?p - peg) :precondition (and (owned-by ?x agent_2) (on ?x ?from) (clear ?x) (clear ?p)) :effect (and (not (on ?x ?from)) (on ?x ?p) (clear ?from) (not (clear ?p)) (clear ?x))) (:action move_to_disk_agent_2 :parameters (?x - disk ?from - support ?y - disk) :precondition (and (owned-by ?x agent_2) (on ?x ?from) (clear ?x) (clear ?y) (smaller ?x ?y)) :effect (and (not (on ?x ?from)) (on ?x ?y) (clear ?from) (not (clear ?y)) (clear ?x))) (:action move_to_peg_agent_3 :parameters (?x - disk ?from - support ?p - peg) :precondition (and (owned-by ?x agent_3) (on ?x ?from) (clear ?x) (clear ?p)) :effect (and (not (on ?x ?from)) (on ?x ?p) (clear ?from) (not (clear ?p)) (clear ?x))) (:action move_to_disk_agent_3 :parameters (?x - disk ?from - support ?y - disk) :precondition (and (owned-by ?x agent_3) (on ?x ?from) (clear ?x) (clear ?y) (smaller ?x ?y)) :effect (and (not (on ?x ?from)) (on ?x ?y) (clear ?from) (not (clear ?y)) (clear ?x))))</domain>

local_plan.system_prompt: You are agent_1 and can move only disks A, B, C, D, E. You must produce a sequence of primitive moves that obey Tower of Hanoi rules and your ownership constraints.
local_plan.prompt: Use the public information and your private knowledge to propose a step-by-step legal move sequence over disks A-E only toward the goal configuration. Output each primitive step as 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2' using peg names left, middle, right. Do not include PDDL.

local_plan.system_prompt: You are agent_2 and can move only disks F, G, H, I, J. You must obey Tower of Hanoi rules and your ownership constraints.
local_plan.prompt: If any moves over disks F-J are necessary to achieve the goal, propose them as primitive steps in the format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. If no such moves are needed, return an empty list and a brief justification. Do not include PDDL.

local_plan.system_prompt: You are agent_3 and can move only disks K, L, M, N, O. You must obey Tower of Hanoi rules and your ownership constraints.
local_plan.prompt: If any moves over disks K-O are necessary to achieve the goal, propose them as primitive steps in the format 'agent_3: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. If no such moves are needed, return an empty list and a brief justification. Do not include PDDL.

audit.system_prompt: You are the auditor. Check temporal and causal consistency, ensure no bookkeeping shortcuts, verify every move is legal under Tower of Hanoi rules and agent permissions, and confirm the final state matches the goal.
audit.prompt: Audit the integrated candidate plan for legality and goal satisfaction. If issues are found, propose minimal corrections. Output an object with fields 'status' (ok or error), 'issues' (list), and 'audited_moves' (the corrected ordered primitive moves). Do not include PDDL.

integration.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Merge agents' proposals into a single linearized sequence consistent with Tower of Hanoi rules and agent ownership.
integration.prompt: Integrate the agents' proposed moves into one ordered list in the format 'agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Prefer the shortest valid sequence that reaches the specified goal. Do not include PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with PDDL problems for the FastDownward solver. Produce a final PDDL domain and problem file that encode the 3-peg, 15-disk Tower of Hanoi with agent-specific move permissions. Enclose the domain in <domain></domain> and the problem in <problem></problem>.
pddl.prompt: Using the public information and the audited integrated moves, output the final PDDL domain and problem targeting FastDownward. Encode disks a..o, pegs left middle right, agent constants agent_1 agent_2 agent_3, a static smaller relation, owned-by constraints, and actions that enforce agent-specific permissions. Use types and clear/on predicates as in classical Hanoi encodings. Enclose the domain in <domain></domain> and the problem in <problem></problem>.
